content.description: A raging chosspile of a route that has nothing innovative or creative on it. Start sitting using the flake and whatever else on your left for hands. Do the only fun move and then move up through jugs hoping nothing breaks, topping out just left of the small tree. Stay to the left of the arete for the whole route.
content.protection: This is a high ball. Bring a couple pads.
content.location: This is just left of the arete behind the Moonchild boulder when coming down from big blocks. The start of this boulder is on the far side of this face to the right of the Moonchild route.

content.description: Short, technical, and powerful. Sit start under the roof in the center with a left hand sidepull and a right hand pinch. Reach out to a blocky sloper and some sharp crimps at the lip of the lower block feature. Huck a huge hard move to a sloping jug and use crimps to reach the lip and topout.
content.protection: Two or three pads would be ideal.
content.location: This line starts in the center of the Moonchild Roof.

content.description:
Sit start just to the right of the roof on a good rail. Move up and left following good holds along the lip of the roof. Traverse until you find the best jugs just past the tip of the roof and mantle to topout.

The best down climb is about 10' climber's right of the start of the climb. Be careful if you decide to down climb right near the start of the climb. There is a large, precarious rock balanced on the lip of the boulder that looks like it would make a great handhold.
content.location: On the right side of the roof on the Moonchild boulder just below Big Blocks.

content.description: Sit start low next to the tree and climb up and slightly right through sloping features to the lip of the boulder and topout.
content.location: This line is on the downhill side of the Moonchild boulder.

content.description: Sit start on two slot crimps on the left most side of the roof. Traverse the big sloper jugs all the way around the crescent until you reach the same topout as Moonstruck (aka Lunacy).
content.protection: Two pads minimum are ideal since this is a longer traverse.
content.location: This line sit starts all the way to the left on the roof of the Moonchild Boulder. Purple line on the topo.
